item.title: Anthropic in Talks to Raise Funding at $60 Billion Value
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- OpenAI rival Anthropic is in advanced talks to raise $2 billion in a funding round that would value the startup at $60 billion, according to two people familiar with the matter. Lightspeed Venture Partners is leading the round, said the people, who spoke on condition of anonymity to ...

item.title: Panasonic Teams Up With Anthropic, Aims for 30% of Sales From AI
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Panasonic Holdings Corp. will embrace artificial intelligence technology across its hardware and software businesses and team up with Anthropic, one of the leaders in the industry, with the goal of boosting AI-related revenue to 30% in a decade, Chief Executive Officer Yuki Kusumi sai...

item.title: ECB Says Consumer Inflation Expectations Increased in November
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Inflation expectations of consumers in the euro area increased in November, the European Central Bank said. Prices were seen rising 2.6% over the next 12 months, up from 2.5% in October, according to its monthly survey of households released in Frankfurt on Tuesday. The gauge for thre...

item.title: Euro-Zone Inflation Rebounds But Won’t Derail ECB Rate Cuts
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Euro-area inflation accelerated last month, supporting the European Central Bank’s gradual approach to reducing interest rates, without derailing them altogether. Consumer prices rose 2.4% from a year ago in December, up from 2.2% in November and matching the median estimate in a Blo...

item.title: France’s Slight Inflation Pickup Backs Cautious ECB Cutting
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- French inflation accelerated in December, supporting the European Central Bank’s plan to only lower interest rates gradually. Consumer prices in the euro area’s second-largest economy were up 1.8% from a year ago in December — faster than November’s 1.7%, statistics agency Insee said....

item.author: cash.ch
item.description: Wie es kurzfristig weitergeht, dürfte nun vor allem von den Konjunkturzahlen beeinflusst werden, heisst es am Markt weiter. item.title: Dow Jones steigt traditionell zu Jahresbeginn - eine Chance für risikofreudige Anleger
item.author: cash.ch
item.description: Georg Pröbstl 2022 war eine Ausnahme. Aber in dieses Jahr fiel auch der Beginn des Kriegs in der Ukraine, es wurden Sanktionen gegen Russland verhängt, verbunden mit immensen Preissteigerungen zuerst bei Rohstoffen und dann querbeet so gut wie über alle Güter und Leistungen. Und all das brachte natü...

item.title: „Wir können nicht allein auf das Silicon Valley setzen“
